Description: Lack of diversity in cancer research contributes to persistent disparities in cancer prevention, treatment, and outcomes. Public health agencies, academic and research institutions, and others have recognized the need to engage populations that have historically been underrepresented in biomedical research (UBR). However, implementation of this engagement is often superficial, short-term and benefits the researchers more than the community. This session will review models, strategies, and metrics for meaningful and mutually beneficial engagement of UBR populations in cancer research.
SearchResultBody: FO02. Beyond Platitudes and Proclamations: Meaningful Engagement of Diverse Communities in Cancer Research
Title: Beyond Platitudes and Proclamations: Meaningful Engagement of Diverse Communities in Cancer Research
